meanings.meaning: when an army surrounds a town

examples: The English forces laid siege to the city of Tournai.
This fortress could withstand a siege for years if necessary.
The royal forces marched south to lift the siege of Donnington Castle.
wounded at the siege of Edinburgh Castle in 1573
At the very end of the war, Prague again came under siege.

meanings.meaning: when the police, etc. surround a building

examples: The seven-hour armed siege at the school ended peacefully.
The terrorists were shot dead during the siege of the embassy.
The police placed the city centre under a virtual state of siege.
